name: Kreosotum
Relationship: GUAIACOL (is the principal constituent of Kreosote, and similar in action. Used in pulmonary tuberculosis. Dose 1 to 5M.Antidote: NUX. Inimical: CARBO.Compare also: FULIGO LIGNI; CARBOL-AC.; IOD.; LACHES.MATICO - Artanthe or Piper augustifolia, (Gonorrhea, hemorrhage from lungs; catarrhal condition of genitourinary organs and gastrointestinal tract. Topically a hemostatic. Difficult, dry, deep, winter cough. Use tincture.)Complementary in malignant diseases: ARS.; PHOS.; SULPH.

details: Mental.Music causes weeping and palpitation. Vanishing of thought; stupid, forgetful, peevish, irritable. Child wants everything but throws it away when given.Pulsations all over the body, and profuse bleeding from small wounds. Very severe, old neuralgic affections; pains rather aggravated by rest. EXCORIATING, burning, and offensive discharges. Hemorrhages, ulcerations, cancerous affections. Rapid decomposition of fluids and secretions, and burning pains. Overgrown, poorly developed children. Post-climacteric diseases. Tumefaction, puffiness, gangrene. Ailings of teething children.Kreosotum is a mixture of phenol obtained from this distillation.
dosage: Third to thirtieth potency. The 200th in sensitive patients.
